thread.title: No-fly zone to be enforced over William and Kate's home
thread.title_full: No-fly zone to be enforced over William and Kate's home | Deccan Chronicle

author: AP
title: No-fly zone to be enforced over William and Kate's home
text:
AP | October 08, 2015, 21.18 pm Prince William and his wife Kate Middleton. (Photo: AFP) London: British authorities are enforcing a no-fly zone over Prince William and his wife Kate's country home for security reasons.
The move, which comes into force on November 1, prohibits planes and drones flying below 2,000 feet (610 meters) within a circular area 1.5 miles across over Amner Hall, located on Queen Elizabeth II's Sandringham country estate in eastern England.
In a legal document explaining the move, the Department of Transport said the restrictions came at the request of the security services.
William, Kate and their children George and Charlotte spend much of their time at Anmer Hall, a secluded 10-bedroom mansion.
Similar regulations have been imposed over Sandringham to cover the winter weeks when the queen resides there.
